intro: Lappula saurica, commonly known as the common lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Camelotaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist soils along riverbanks and wet meadows. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Lappula saurica is known for its ability to thrive in wet environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
